intro: Clarkia pulcherrima, commonly known as the showy clarkia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is a member of the evening primrose family (Onagraceae) and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, wind-dispersed seeds. Clarkia pulcherrima is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and public landscapes.
